title: Force live reload via `s` keypress not working in remote development mode
body:
### Describe the bug

`s` keypress doesn't work to force live reload in remote development mode.

According to comments from @maxandersen in [this discussion](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/discussions/31335#discussioncomment-5089581) it should work.

I've struggled to find documentation of this functionality, but when running local development I can press `s` and then `enter` in my gradle build output and it will force a live reload, but when using remote development mode, it appears to do nothing.

The only place I've found any documentation of this feature is in the gradle build output itself, where it says `Press [h] for more options` and doing so lists various commands, including `s` to force a live reload. It's maybe worth noting that this instruction does _not_ appear when running the remote development build, so perhaps it's not supposed to work here?

### Expected behavior

Pressing `s` (the `enter`) will force a live reload.

### Actual behavior

Nothing happens.

### How to Reproduce?

I'll have to get back to you with a link to a reproducer, if it's necessary. As I'll need to find a simpler way to initiate remote development than my current project (which involves microk8s running in a multipass VM).
